Switch clarity ON OFF Privacy policy close Study Research Explore Connect School of Computing Science Our staffProfessor Dimitrios PezarosMr Ethan KellyZhen Tian Professor Dimitrios Pezaros Professor of Computer Networks and RAEng Research Chair (Computing Science) telephone: 01413306051 email: Dimitrios.Pezaros@glasgow.ac.uk Room S162, Computing Science, Sir Alwyn Williams Bldg, Glasgow G12 8RZ Import to contacts https://orcid.org/0000-0003-0939-378X Biography I am (full) Professor of Computer Networks in the School of Computing Science at the University of Glasgow, where I hold the Royal Academy of Engineering Research Chair in Digital Resilience for Critical National Infrastructure and I lead the Cybersecurity research theme. I am founding director of the Networked Systems Research Laboratory (netlab) since 2015 and director of Glasgow's Cyberdefence lab since 2020, and I have been the head of the Glasgow Systems Section (GLASS) between 2019-2023. I currently serve on the Engineering and Physical Sciences Research Council (EPSRC) Digital Security and Resilience (DS&R) Strategic Advisory Team (SAT). I was visiting professor at the University of Athens, Department of Informatics and Telecommunications during 2018-19. I have published widely and am leading research in computer communications, network and service management, and digital resilience of future and heterogeneous networked infrastructures, exploring technologies such as network programmability and function virtualisation and how they can be applied to resource-constrained and industrial (IT/OT) environments. I have received significant funding for my research from EPSRC, the European Comission (EC), the Defence Science and Technology Laboratory (Dstl), the Royal Academy of Engineering (RAEng), the London Mathematical Society (LMS), the US Federal Aviation Administration (FAA), and industry (incl. BT, EDF, NXP, etc.). Prior to joining Glasgow as a lecturer (assistant professor) in 2009, I have held postdoctoral and senior research associate positions at Lancaster University, where I worked on a number of EPSRC and EU-funded projects in the areas of network measurement and management, traffic engineering, autonomic communications, and network resilience. I hold BSc (Hons.) and PhD degrees in Computer Science from Lancaster University, and have been a doctoral fellow of Agilent Technologies Inc. between 2000 and 2004. I am a chartered engineer, a fellow of the BCS and the IET, a fellow of the HEA, and a senior member of the IEEE and the ACM. I serve as Associate Editor on the editorial boards of IEEE Transactions on Network and Service Management (TNSM) and IEEE Transactions on Mobile Computing (TMC).
